articles.description: Xabi Alonso announces he will remain as manager of Bayer Leverkusen beyond this summer despite interest from Liverpool and Bayern Munich.
articles.title: 'My job is not over here' - Alonso to stay at Leverkusen

articles.description: Follow live text commentary and score updates from the Championship, starting with promotion-chasing Leicester's trip to Bristol City.
articles.title: Championship: Bristol City v Leicester starts bumper day of games

articles.description: Thomas Tuchel says England and Bayern Munich striker Harry Kane has recovered from an ankle injury and is fit to face Borussia Dortmund on Saturday.
articles.title: Bayern striker Kane passed fit for Der Klassiker

articles.description: Andy Murray will not compete at April's Monte Carlo Masters and BMW Open after he ruptured ankle ligaments at the Miami Open.
articles.title: Andy Murray: No timescale for three-time Grand Slam champion's return after ankle injury

articles.description: Grigor Dimitrov knocks out top seed Carlos Alcaraz to set up a Miami Open semi-final meeting with fourth seed Alexander Zverev.
articles.title: Miami Open: Carlos Alcaraz stunned by Grigor Dimitrov in last eight, but Alexander Zverev through

articles.description: Anis Mehmeti's second-half stunner piles more misery on Championship title-chasers Leicester City as they lost 1-0 to Bristol City.
articles.title: Bristol City defeat piles pressure on Leicester

articles.description: Bayer Leverkusen boss Xabi Alonso says it is "the right place" for him as he confirms he will remain at the club next season despite interest from Liverpool and Bayern Munich.
articles.title: Bayer Leverkusen is right place for me to be - Alonso

articles.description: England overcome a spirited performance from New Zealand to win the fifth and final T20 in Wellington and wrap up a 4-1 series win.
articles.title: England claim victory over New Zealand in final T20

articles.description: Wolves boss Gary O'Neil says there is "no truth" in reported interest from Manchester United but adds it is an honour to be linked to the club.
articles.title: Wolves' O'Neil says 'no truth' in Man Utd rumours

articles.description: Eddie Howe hopes Newcastle midfielder Sandro Tonali avoids further consequences for alleged breaches of the FA's betting rules.
articles.title: Howe hopes banned Tonali faces no more punishment
